p: Figure 2 clearly shows that the gathering and use of plant genera that, accordingly to the Italian botanical reference flora [ 38], mainly grow in pastures, forests and higher mountain areas (underlined in the figure) has ceased, while the collection of cultivated medicinal plants or medicinal plants growing in more anthropogenic environments [ 38] has been newly introduced. This is similar to what has been observed for the patterns of change in wild food plant knowledge in Europe [ 22, 30].
